title: Using dropout
text: Survey data frequently faces issue dropout — situations participants leave sections survey incomplete. Effectively managing dropouts key preserving data quality gaining deeper understanding participants’ response patterns. dropout package addresses challenge providing tools analyze interpret participant behavior throughout survey process.

what: Use cases of the dropout package
title: Using dropout
text: Identifying specific survey points participants tend stop completing survey. Detecting sections frequently skipped respondents. Quantifying extent locations dropouts within survey. Estimating proportion missing values attributed dropouts column. Profiling respondents discontinued survey pinpointing dropout points.
code: library(dropout) #> dropout package (v2.2.0) includes significant updates to the codebase, aimed at reducing unexpected behavior and minimizing dependencies. #> If these changes cause issues with your existing code, you can access a previous version of the package from the archive. #> For more information, visit: #> https://github.com/hendr1km/dropout

title: Using dropout
text: drop_summary function provides overview extent participants tend stop answering questions. highlights patterns missing values, whether participants skipping specific questions entire sections survey.
code: drop_summary(flying) #>                         column drop sec_na sec_length single_na  na complete #> 1                respondent_id    0      0          0         0   0     1.00 #> 2             travel_frequency    0      0          0         0   0     1.00 #> 3                 seat_recline   18    164         20         0 182     0.82 #> 4                       height    0    164          0        12 194     0.81 #> 5            children_under_18    1    164          0         6 189     0.82 #> 6                 two_armrests    1    164          0         0 184     0.82 #> 7               middle_armrest    0    164          0         0 184     0.82 #> 8                 window_shade    0    164          0         0 184     0.82 #> 9        moving_to_unsold_seat    1    164          0         0 185     0.82 #> 10         talking_to_seatmate    0    164          0         0 185     0.82 #> 11 getting_up_on_6_hour_flight    0    164          0         0 185     0.82 #> 12 obligation_to_reclined_seat    1    164          0         0 186     0.82 #> 13       recline_seat_rudeness    0    164          0         0 186     0.82 #> 14   eliminate_reclining_seats    0    164          0         0 186     0.82 #> 15          switch_for_friends    4    164          0         0 190     0.82 #> 16           switch_for_family    0    164          0         0 190     0.82 #> 17     wake_passenger_bathroom    0    164          0         0 190     0.82 #> 18         wake_passenger_walk    0    164          0         0 190     0.82 #> 19               baby_on_plane    1    164          0         0 191     0.82 #> 20             unruly_children    0    164          0         0 191     0.82 #> 21       electronics_violation    0    164          0         0 191     0.82 #> 22           smoking_violation    0    164          0         0 191     0.82 #> 23                      gender    6      0          0         0  33     0.97 #> 24                         age    0      0 location_census_region    9      0          0         0  42     0.96

title: Using dropout
text: detailed analysis, drop_detect function identifies individual participants dropped survey. returns index participant column dropout occurred, helping focus critical dropout points.
code: drop_detect(flying) |>   head() #>    drop drop_index       column #> 1  TRUE          3 seat_recline #> 2 FALSE         NA         <NA> #> 3 FALSE         NA         <NA> #> 4 FALSE         NA         <NA> #> 5 FALSE         NA         <NA> #> 6 FALSE         NA         <NA>

title: Handling Incomplete Responses in Survey Data Analysis
text: latest version dropout package introduces significant updates codebase, aimed reducing unexpected behavior minimizing dependencies directly utilizing R’s built-C API. need access previous version package, can download Figshare.

title: Handling Incomplete Responses in Survey Data Analysis
text: can install development version dropout GitHub using following command:
code: # Install the released version from CRAN install.packages("dropout")  # development version from GitHub: devtools::install_github("hendr1km/dropout")

title: Handling Incomplete Responses in Survey Data Analysis
text: drop_detect: Detects participants drop survey recognizing NA sequences last question survey. Additionally, function provides column name index dropout occurs. dropout_summary: Offers high-level summary dropout occurrences, providing key statistics understand patterns participant dropouts across different survey questions. practical examples please refer package vignette.

title: Detect Instances of Dropout in Data — drop_detect
text: dataframe containing following columns: drop: logical value indicating whether dropout occurred (TRUE dropout, FALSE otherwise). drop_index: index column dropout occurred (NA dropout). column: name column dropout occurred (<NA> dropout).

code: if (FALSE) { # Example usage with the 'flying' dataframe detect_result <- drop_detect(flying) print(detect_result) }

what: Summarize Missing Data Metrics for Each Column — drop_summary
title: Summarize Missing Data Metrics for Each Column — drop_summary
text: drop_summary function generates summary missing data (NA values) column dataframe. computes various metrics number dropout participants, section NAs, mode length missing value sections , proportion complete cases column.

title: Summarize Missing Data Metrics for Each Column — drop_summary
Summarize Missing Data Metrics for Each Column — drop_summary
text: data dataframe analyze missing data.

title: Summarize Missing Data Metrics for Each Column — drop_summary
text: dataframe containing following columns: column: name column input dataframe. drop: number dropped rows (missing values) column. sec_na: number sections consecutive NAs column. sec_length: mode (frequent length) sections consecutive NAs column. single_na: number single NA values (isolated missing values) column. na: total number missing (NA) values column. complete: proportion complete rows column, value 1 means missing data, values closer 0 mean missing data.

title: Summarize Missing Data Metrics for Each Column — drop_summary
text: function calls C API compute metrics, processed returned summary dataframe.

title: Summarize Missing Data Metrics for Each Column — drop_summary
code: if (FALSE) { # Example usage with the 'flying' dataframe summary_result <- drop_summary(flying) print(summary_result) }

title: Flying Etiquette Survey Data — flying
text: modified version Flying Etiquette Survey data behind story: 41 percent flyers say rude recline seat airplane.

title: Flying Etiquette Survey Data — flying
Flying Etiquette Survey Data — flying
text: dataframe 1040 obs. 28 columns, : respondent_id respondentid travel_frequency often travel plane? seat_recline ever recline seat fly? height tall ? children_under_18 children 18? two_armrests row three seats, get use two arm rests? middle_armrest row two seats, get use middle arm rest? window_shade control window shade? moving_to_unsold_seat rude move unsold seat plane? talking_to_seatmate generally speaking, rude say words stranger sitting next plane? getting_up_on_6_hour_flight 6 hour flight nyc la, many times acceptable get aisle seat? obligation_to_reclined_seat rude recline seat plane? eliminate_reclining_seats given opportunity, eliminate possibility reclining seats planes entirely? switch_for_friends rude ask someone switch seats order closer friends? switch_for_family rude ask someone switch seats order closer family? wake_passenger_bathroom rude wake passenger trying go bathroom? wake_passenger_walk rude wake passenger trying walk around? baby_on_plane general, rude bring baby plane? unruly_children general, rude knowingly bring unruly children plane? electronics_violation ever used personal electronics take landing violation flight attendant's direction? smoking_violation ever smoked cigarette airplane bathroom rules? gender gender age age household_income household income education education location_census_region location (census region) survey_type type survey

title: dropout 1.0.0 (Release date: 2023-09-01)
text: CRAN release: 2023-08-31 Initial CRAN release.

title: dropout 2.0 (Release date: 2023-09-11)
text: Issues related functions resolved, components implemented C++ enhanced performance.

title: dropout 2.1 (Release date: 2023-09-28)
text: Issues related functions resolved, appearing working different data types surveys

title: dropout 2.2 (Release date: 2024-10-15)
text: Dependency Enforcements: package now leverages calls native C API, eliminating need enforce dependencies. change ensures improved performance long-term sustainability package. Refined output interface: Minor adjustments made functions, resulting cleaner, user-friendly experience less prone unexpected behaviour.
